definition: (coll.) adults still living with and depending on their parents
to gnaw/to nibble/to bite

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
race/nationality/ethnicity/clan/by extension, social group (e.g. office workers 上班族)

sentences.english: The boomerang kid phenomenon has become a social problem on a nationwide scale.
sentences.chinese: 啃老族已成爲全國性的社會問題。

sentences.english: Some become boomerang kids , only enjoy the life.
sentences.chinese: 有的乾脆做起“啃老族”，只享受生活。

sentences.english: "The boomerang kid" refers to the life of young people depend on their parents.
sentences.chinese: “啃老族”指的是依靠父母生活的年輕人。

sentences.english: This Neet is already 30 years old but still lives off his parents.
sentences.chinese: 這個啃老族已經30歲了，但仍然依靠他的父母生活。

sentences.english: Contray to that is the appearance of the "Dependent Generation".
sentences.chinese: 與此相對的是“啃老族”的出現。

sentences.english: Receiving financial support from parents is the most common practice among the NEET group.
sentences.chinese: 接受父母的經濟支持在“啃老族”中是最常見的做法。

definition: (coll.) to live with and depend on one's parents even upon reaching adulthood
car slave, sb forced to sacrifice quality of life to buy or maintain a car
those who did not benefit from the Chinese economic reforms of the 1980s/see also 富二代[fu4 er4 dai4]
happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give
a slave to one's mortgage
the working poor
"a slave to one's children", hard-working parents who would do everything to ensure their children's well-being, in disregard of their own needs
lit. moonlight group/fig. those who spend their monthly income even before they earn their next salary (slang)
to idle about
to love ease and comfort and hate work (idiom)
unemployed person/vagrant/rogue
to live off a woman
an only child
(Internet slang) guy who grew up in the countryside and gained a foothold in the city through hard work
lit. just sitting and eating, one can deplete even a mountain of wealth (idiom)/fig. to spend one's money without generating any income
mama's boy
